alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 02 at 9:49PM EDT until July 03 at 6:22AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Mount Holly NJ has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Delaware... Christina River At Coochs Bridge affecting New Castle County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL TOMORROW MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Christina River At Coochs Bridge. * WHEN...Until tomorrow morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Flooding begins in fields and floodplain adjacent to the river. At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins in the town of Christiana. East Main Street (Del 7) begins to flood as does Water Street. Meadow Road near New Castle Airport is subject to flooding. Barksdale Road near Casho Mill Road is also subject to flooding as are residential backyards. At 11.5 feet, Portions of Duross Heights near New Castle Airport begin to flood including Don Avenue. Airport Road at the New Castle Airport begins to flood as the Christina River backs up the Nonesuch Creek. Walther Road in the Bear area also floods. Flooding also occurs around Smalley`s Pond Dam in Christiana. At 12.0 feet, Significant flooding occurs on Meadow Road in Christiana. Roads are closed. Homes are flooded. Salem Church Road and Reybold Road floods in Christiana also flood and are subject to closures. Residential backyards can flood in this area. Flooding also occurs in Newark on West Chestnut Hill Road and South College Avenue. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:16 PM EDT Saturday the stage was 10.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this evening to a crest of 11.3 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 11.3 feet on 11/17/2002. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (10 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sun Mon Stg Time Date Christina River Coochs Bridge 11.0 10.3 Sat 9 pm 4.0 MSG 11.3 12am 7/03 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning by 630 AM EDT.
